maml:description.maml:para: Import an enclosure.

This cmdlet will import an enclosure for HP OneView management. The Onboard Administrator needs to have at least an IP Address for each OA module, and a valid Administrator account. An Enclosure Group must also be created.
Add-HPOVEnclosure will attempt a connection to the XML Reply interface to examine if an existing VC Domain is present. If so, you are prompted if you wish to continue and force import the enclosure. FORCE IMPORT OF AN ENCLOSURE WILL DELETE ANY EXISTING VC DOMAIN CONFIGURATION, AND NOT PERFORM ANY VC DOMAIN CONFIGURATION MIGRATION. PLEASE BACKUP YOUR VC DOMAIN IF YOU WISH TO RESTORE TO ITS ORIGINAL CONFIGURATION.
Aliases [-oa] REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target OA.
Aliases [-eg] REQUIRED. Enclosure Group Name to associate with the enclosure to import.
Aliases [-u, -user] REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target OA.
Aliases [-p, -pw] REQUIRED. Account password of the OA specified.

Aliases [-license, -l] REQUIRED. Specifies whether the intent is to apply either OneView or OneView w/o iLO licenses to the servers in the enclosure being imported.
Accepted values are
• OneView • OneViewNoiLO
Aliases [-fwIso] OPTIONAL. SPP Baseline file name. e.g. SPP2013090_2013_0830_30.iso
Aliases [-forceFw, -forceInstall] OPTIONAL. Force the installation of the provided Firmware Baseline.
[DEPRECATE PARAMETER] Please use the standard -Confirm:$false PowerShell Parameter to force import an enclosure and bypass the confirmation prompt.

When attempting to add a Server to the appliance, the appliance will validate the target Server is not already claimed. If it is, this parameter is used when the server has been claimed by another appliance to bypass the confirmation prompt, and force add the server resource.
Aliases [-oa] REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target OA.
Aliases [-u, -user] REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target OA.
Aliases [-p, -pw] REQUIRED. Account password of the OA specified.

OPTIONAL. Add the specified enclosure for monitor only management. You can view hardware for inventory and status information only. Omitting this parameter, you can apply configurations, deploy server profiles, monitor operation status, collect statistics, and alert users to specific conditions.

When attempting to add a Server to the appliance, the appliance will validate the target Server is not already claimed. If it is, this parameter is used when the server has been claimed by another appliance to bypass the confirmation prompt, and force add the server resource.
Aliases [-oa] REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target OA.
Aliases [-eg] REQUIRED. Enclosure Group Name to associate with the enclosure to import.
Aliases [-u, -user] REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target OA.
Aliases [-p, -pw] REQUIRED. Account password of the OA specified.

Aliases [-license, -l] REQUIRED. Specifies whether the intent is to apply either OneView or OneView w/o iLO licenses to the servers in the enclosure being imported.
Accepted values are
• OneView • OneViewNoiLO
Aliases [-fwIso] OPTIONAL. SPP Baseline file name. e.g. SPP2013090_2013_0830_30.iso
Aliases [-forceFw, -forceInstall] OPTIONAL. Force the installation of the provided Firmware Baseline.

OPTIONAL. Add the specified enclosure for monitor only management. You can view hardware for inventory and status information only. Omitting this parameter, you can apply configurations, deploy server profiles, monitor operation status, collect statistics, and alert users to specific conditions.
[DEPRECATE PARAMETER] Please use the standard -Confirm:$false PowerShell Parameter to force import an enclosure and bypass the confirmation prompt.

When attempting to add a Server to the appliance, the appliance will validate the target Server is not already claimed. If it is, this parameter is used when the server has been claimed by another appliance to bypass the confirmation prompt, and force add the server resource.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Async task Resource object for monitoring the enclosure import process.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-HPOVEnclosure -oa "192.168.1.1" -enclGroupName EG1 -user admin -pass hpinvent -license OneView Add a new enclosure to the appliance, using the EG1 Enclosure Group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-HPOVEnclosure -oa "192.168.1.1" -enclGroupName EG1 -user admin -pass hpinvent -license OneView -confirm:$false Add a new enclosure to the appliance, using the EG1 Enclosure Group, and force add the target enclosure. THIS IS A DISTRUCTIVE PROCESS IF AN EXISTING VC DOMAIN EXISTS.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-HPOVEnclosure -oa "192.168.1.1" -user admin -pass hpinvent -monitored Add a new enclosure to the appliance for monitoring only.

maml:description.maml:para: Add a supported SAN Manager

Add a new SAN Manager to the appliance. SAN Managers are hardware or software systems that manage SANs. The SAN Managers resource enables you to bring SAN management systems and the SANs they manage under management of the appliance. You can associate the managed SANs to Fibre Channel networks on the appliance when creating a (New-HPOVNetwork) or updating an existing (Set-HPOVNetwork) Fibre Channel Network Resource. This enables the appliance to automate zoning to make the SANs visible to server profiles. Zoning defines connections between Fibre Channel endpoints. Zones are a group of endpoints that can communicate with each other. Open SANs allow communication between all endpoints.
Supported SAN Managers are 'Brocade SAN Network Advisor' and 'NP Networking 5900CP'. Please see the HP OneView Support Matrix for supported versions.

SAN Manager type to add. Accepted values are:
• bna or Brocade Network Advisor • HP (HPN 5900CP)
FQDN or IP Address of the SAN Manager
TCP Port of the SAN Manager. The default port for Brocade Network Advisor is '5989'. The default port for HPN 5900CP is '161'.
Username used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager. For the HPN SAN Manager, this parameter corrisponds to the SSHUserAccount
Password used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager
Use to enable SSL communication with the SAN Manager (specifically for the BNA SAN Manager type.)

SAN Manager type to add. Accepted values are:
• bna or Brocade Network Advisor • HP (HPN 5900CP)
FQDN or IP Address of the SAN Manager
TCP Port of the SAN Manager. The default port for Brocade Network Advisor is '5989'. The default port for HPN 5900CP is '161'.
Username used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager. For the HPN SAN Manager, this parameter corrisponds to the SSHUserAccount
Password used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager
The SNMPv3 Community User Name.

The SNMPv3 Authentication Level. Allowed values are:
• None - No Security is required, only the SNMPv3 UserName is provided. • AuthOnly - SNMPv3 Authentication Encryption Security Level only. Must also provide -SnmpAuthProtocol and -SnmpAuthPassword parameters. • AuthAndPriv - SNMPv3 Authentication Encryption Security and Privacy Levels. Must also provide -SnmpAuthProtocol, -SnmpAuthPassword, -SnmpPrivProtocol and -SnmpPrivPassword parameters.

SNMPv3 Password Encryption Protocol. Allowed values are:
• SHA • MD5
SNMPv3 UserName Password.

SNMPv3 Privacy Protocol. Allowed values are:
• AES • DES
SNMPv3 Privacy Encryption Password.

SAN Manager type to add. Accepted values are:
• bna or Brocade Network Advisor • HP (HPN 5900CP)
FQDN or IP Address of the SAN Manager
TCP Port of the SAN Manager. The default port for Brocade Network Advisor is '5989'. The default port for HPN 5900CP is '161'.
Username used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager. For the HPN SAN Manager, this parameter corrisponds to the SSHUserAccount
Password used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager
The SNMPv3 Community User Name.

The SNMPv3 Authentication Level. Allowed values are:
• None - No Security is required, only the SNMPv3 UserName is provided. • AuthOnly - SNMPv3 Authentication Encryption Security Level only. Must also provide -SnmpAuthProtocol and -SnmpAuthPassword parameters. • AuthAndPriv - SNMPv3 Authentication Encryption Security and Privacy Levels. Must also provide -SnmpAuthProtocol, -SnmpAuthPassword, -SnmpPrivProtocol and -SnmpPrivPassword parameters.

SNMPv3 Password Encryption Protocol. Allowed values are:
• SHA • MD5
SNMPv3 UserName Password.

SNMPv3 Privacy Protocol. Allowed values are:
• AES • DES
SNMPv3 Privacy Encryption Password.
Use to enable SSL communication with the SAN Manager (specifically for the BNA SAN Manager type.)

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Async task.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $task = Add-HPOVSanManager -type BNA -hostname BNA.contoso.com -username Administrator -password password -usessl PS C:\> Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task
Add a new Brocade Network Advisor SAN Manager.

maml:description.maml:para: Import a physical server.

Import a physical server. This cmdlet is not used to add a Blade Server to the appliance, only supported DL Gen 8 servers. A BL server will automatically be discovered once it inserted into an enclosure being managed by the appliance.
REQUIRED. Hostname of the server's iLO, either IP Address or FQDN.
REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target iLO.
REQUIRED. Account password of the iLO specified.

REQUIRED. Specifies whether the intent is to apply either OneView or OneView w/o iLO licenses to the server being imported.
Accepted values are
• OneView • OneViewNoiLO

[DEPRECATED] OPTIONAL. Force the import of the server when currently managed by another OneView appliance, and will bypass the confirmation prompt. The -Force parameter is not combined with the -Confirm standard parameter.

When attempting to add a Server to the appliance, the appliance will validate the target Server is not already claimed. If it is, this parameter is used when the server has been claimed by another appliance to bypass the confirmation prompt, and force add the server resource.

maml:description.maml:para: Upload new SPP Baseline to appliance firmware repository.
This cmdlet provides the ability to upload a new SPP Baseline into the appliance. It will return after the upload has completed but before the SPP file has been imported into the firmware repository.
The full path and file name of the SPP file. The function returns an error if the file path cannot be validated.
The full path and file name of the SPP file. The function returns an error if the file path cannot be validated.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: The progress of uploading the file to the appliance, and completion result.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-HPOVSppFile "C:\Users\me\Documents\SPP2012060B.2012_0525.1.iso" Upload SPP ISO into appliance.

maml:description.maml:para: Add managed Storage Pools.
Add new Storage Pools (i.e. HP 3PAR Common Provisioning Group [CPG]) for volumes to be provisioned from. The Storage System must be imported prior to adding Storage Pools.

Aliases: [Pool, spName, CPG] REQUIRED. An array containing the name(s) of the specific storage pool resource(s) to be added during storage system import.
Example: $pools = "cpg1","cpg2"

Aliases: [Pool, spName, CPG] REQUIRED. An array containing the name(s) of the specific storage pool resource(s) to be added during storage system import.
Example: $pools = "cpg1","cpg2"
Storage System resource object from Get-HPOVStorageSystem.
Async task resource.
Multiple async task resources.

dev:type.maml:name: Async Task(s) to monitor storage pool import.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-HPOVStoragePool -StorageSystem "HP3PAR_1" -PoolName "HP_CPG1" Add the "HP_CPG1" Stroage Pool that is mananaged in the HP3PAR_1 Storage System. PoolName parameter data type will be converted from System.String to System.Array.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $myPools = "cpg1","cpg2" PS C:\> Add-HPOVStoragePool "HP3PAR_1" $myPools
Add the "HP_CPG1" Stroage Pool that is mananaged in the HP3PAR_1 Storage System.

maml:description.maml:para: Add managed Storage Pools.
Add new Storage Pools (i.e. HP 3PAR Common Provisioning Group [CPG]) for volumes to be provisioned from. The Storage System must be imported prior to adding Storage Pools.

Aliases: [Pool, spName, CPG] REQUIRED. An array containing the name(s) of the specific storage pool resource(s) to be added during storage system import.
Example: $pools = "cpg1","cpg2"

Aliases: [Pool, spName, CPG] REQUIRED. An array containing the name(s) of the specific storage pool resource(s) to be added during storage system import.
Example: $pools = "cpg1","cpg2"

maml:description.maml:para: Import a supported Storage System

This cmdlet will assist with importing a supported Storage System. In order for the Storage Ports to be mapped to Expected Networks, either a Supported SAN Manager will need to be configured, or 3PAR Direct Attach networks will have to exist.
When adding supported HP 3PAR storage systems, please make sure "startwsapi" has been executed from the HP 3PAR CLI, which enables the HP 3PAR REST API that is required by HP OneView.
REQUIRED. IP Address of FQDN of the storage systems.
REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target storage system.
REQUIRED. Password of administrator account password.
OPTIONAL. Specify the HP 3PAR Virtual Domain name. Default is 'NO DOMAIN'. The value provided is CAsesEnSItive.
OPTIONAL. Specify the Host Ports and Expected Network in an Array of PSCustomObject entries. Example: @{"1:1:1"="Fabric A";"2:2:2"="Fabric B"}
REQUIRED. IP Address of FQDN of the storage systems.
REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target storage system.
REQUIRED. Password of administrator account password.
OPTIONAL. Specify the HP 3PAR Virtual Domain name. Default is 'NO DOMAIN'. The value provided is CAsesEnSItive.
OPTIONAL. Specify the Host Ports and Expected Network in an Array of PSCustomObject entries. Example: @{"1:1:1"="Fabric A";"2:2:2"="Fabric B"}

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Add Storage System Async Task.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $task = Add-HPOVStorageSystem -hostname "3par-array.consoto.com" -username 3paradm -password 3pardata PS C:\> Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task
Add the Storage System using default settings, and let the appliance detect the connected Storage System Ports. (A supported SAN Manager must first be added, and Managed SANs mapped to the specific FC Network resources.)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Import an existing Storage Volume resource.

This cmdlet will help add an existing storage volume that was provisioned on the Storage System. The volume should not be exported or assigned to a server or groups of servers. The Storage Volume also must reside in the Managed Domain of the Stroage System that the appliance managed. The Storage Volume's WWN will be needed.
Required. The Storage System where the volume will be imported from. Volume to be imported must be provisioned to the same Managed Domain as the Storage System.
Aliases [-volid, -id, -wwn] Required. The FC address of the volume to be imported. Address must be in the following format: AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:AA:BB:CC
Aliases [-name] Required. Specify the Storage Volume Name.
Optional. Provide a description for the volume.
Include this switch to mark the Storage Volume as a Shareable resource for shared volume access. Default: Private
Required. The Storage System where the volume will be imported from. Volume to be imported must be provisioned to the same Managed Domain as the Storage System.
Aliases [-volid, -id, -wwn] Required. The FC address of the volume to be imported. Address must be in the following format: AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:AA:BB:CC
Aliases [-name] Required. Specify the Storage Volume Name.
Optional. Provide a description for the volume.
Include this switch to mark the Storage Volume as a Shareable resource for shared volume access. Default: Private
Storage Pool Name or URI
Storage Pool resource object
Async create task

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-HPOVStorageVolume -StorageSystem 3ParSys1 -VolumeID 50:00:2A:C0:03:1E:15:2C -VolumeName 'MyStorageVol1' Import the volume '50:00:2A:C0:03:1E:15:2C' from the '3ParSys1' Storage System.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVStorageSystem 3ParSys1 | Add-HPOVStorageVolume -VolumeID 50:00:2A:C0:03:1E:15:2C -VolumeName 'MyStorageVol1' Import the volume '50:00:2A:C0:03:1E:15:2C' from the '3ParSys1' Storage System.

maml:description.maml:para: Initiate a connection to an HP OneView appliance.

Establish a connection with the specified HP OneView appliance. Logs the user into the appliance and establishes a session for use with subsequent requests. Prompts will be displayed for any omitted values.
Appliance hostname or IP can include an alternate TCP port number. While the appliance does not allow the default TCP port 443 to be changed, the appliance could reside behind a firewall, which is redirecting an alternate TCP port number.
The hostname or IP address of the appliance.
The Directory Name for LDAP/Active Directory authentication, or LOCAL for appliance internal user accounts. Default is LOCAL.
Aliases [-u] User name to authenticate.
Aliases [-p] Password to log into the appliance.
The hostname or IP address of the appliance.
The Directory Name for LDAP/Active Directory authentication, or LOCAL for appliance internal user accounts. Default is LOCAL.
Aliases [-u] User name to authenticate.
Aliases [-p] Password to log into the appliance.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: On successful auth, command prompt will display [username]@[appliance]. If console prompt is disabled via the Set-HPOVPrompt cmdlet, Show-HPOVAppliance can be used.
On error, appliance response is returned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Connect-HPOVMgmt -appliance myappliance.acme.com Connect to a specific appliance FQDN. The user will be prompted for authentication provider, user name and password.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Connect-HPOVMgmt -appliance myappliance.acme.com:11223 Connect to a specific appliance, where the target TCP port isn't the default. The user will be prompted for authentication provider, user name and password.

maml:description.maml:para: Copy Server Profile
This cmdlet will copy a source Server Profile to a new instance You can assign the copy to an existing Server Device, or specify 'unassigned'.
Aliases [-sname] The Name, URI or the Resource Object of the source server profile to be copied.
Aliases [-dname] The name of the destination server profile that will be created. If omitted, the new name will have "Copy of " prefixed to the source name.
The name, URI, or object of the target server to assign the new profile to. If omitted, profile will be 'unassigned'
Aliases [-sname] The Name, URI or the Resource Object of the source server profile to be copied.
Aliases [-dname] The name of the destination server profile that will be created. If omitted, the new name will have "Copy of " prefixed to the source name.
The name, URI, or object of the target server to assign the new profile to. If omitted, profile will be 'unassigned'
Server Profile resource object
Server Profile Name or URI
Profile Create async task

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Copy-HPOVProfile "Profile 1" Copy "Profile 1" to a new Server Profile that is unassigned and named "Copy of Profile 1".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Copy-HPOVProfile "Profile 1" "Profile 2" Copy "Profile 1" to a new Server Profile that is unassigned and named "Profile 2".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Copy-HPOVProfile "Profile 1" "Profile 2" -assign "Encl1, Bay 9" Copy "Profile 1" to a new Server Profile that is assigned to "Encl1, Bay 9" named "Profile 2".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVProfile "Profile 1" | Copy-HPOVProfile Use the Get-HPOVProfile CMDLET and pipe to Copy-HPOVProfile, where the copied profile name will be "Copy of Profile 1" and unassigned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> 11..16 | % { Copy-HPOVProfile "Profile Template" "Profile $_" "Encl1, bay $_" } Copy 5 Server Profiles from "Profile Template" that will be assigned to bays 11 - 16 of Encl1.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Address Pool information.

This cmdlet will get the avilable and configured Address Pools, and their associated Ranges from the appliance. Currently, the appliance supports the following Address Pools:
• VMAC • VWWN • VSN
You can specify one, some or all of the Pool types. A Range switch is provided to include the associated Range objects. A report switch is provided to display a report of each Address Pool type.
The Address Pool type. Accepted values are VMAC, VWWN, VSN, or All.
Include the associated Ranges within the response.
Generate a report view of all or specified Pools. Can include the ranges within the pool.
The Address Pool type. Accepted values are VMAC, VWWN, VSN, or All.
Include the associated Ranges within the response.
Generate a report view of all or specified Pools. Can include the ranges within the pool.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Collection of Address Pools and their contents.
Single Address Pool and its contents.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVAddressPool Get the address pools.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVAddressPool -ranges Get the address pools, and associated ranges.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVAddressPool -type vmac -ranges Get the vmac address pool, and associated ranges.

maml:description.maml:para: List alerts logged.
Obtain all the alerts for the specified resource and/or with the specified severity.
Aliases [-resourceUri] Alerts for the specified resource will be returned.

Alerts with given severity will be returned. Allowed severity values are:
• Unknown • Ok • Disabled • Warning • Critical

Alerts with given health category will be returned. Allowed health category values are:
• Appliance • DeviceBay • Enclosure • Fan • Firmware • Host • Instance • InterconnectBay • LogicalSwitch • Logs • ManagementProcessor • Memory • Network • Operational • Power • Processor • RemoteSupport • Storage • Thermal • Unknown
Alerts assigned to the given user will be returned.
Alerts with given alert state will be returned. State values include Active and Cleared
Aliases [-resourceUri] Alerts for the specified resource will be returned.

Alerts with given severity will be returned. Allowed severity values are:
• Unknown • Ok • Disabled • Warning • Critical
Aliases [-resourceUri] Alerts for the specified resource will be returned.

Alerts with given severity will be returned. Allowed severity values are:
• Unknown • Ok • Disabled • Warning • Critical

Alerts with given health category will be returned. Allowed health category values are:
• Appliance • DeviceBay • Enclosure • Fan • Firmware • Host • Instance • InterconnectBay • LogicalSwitch • Logs • ManagementProcessor • Memory • Network • Operational • Power • Processor • RemoteSupport • Storage • Thermal • Unknown
Alerts assigned to the given user will be returned.
Alerts with given alert state will be returned. State values include Active and Cleared
Resource URI.
Resource object (i.e. Get-HPOVServer).
The matching alerts.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $alerts = Get-HPOVAlert -severity CRITICAL Return all the critical alerts.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVServer 'Encl1, Bay 2' | Get-HPOVAlert -severity CRITICAL Return all the critical alerts for server 'Encl1, Bay 2'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVProfile 'Profile 1' | Get-HPOVAlert Return all the alerts for server profile 'Profile 1'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVInterconnect "Encl1, interconnect 2" | Get-HPOVAlert Get all alerts for 'Encl1, interconnect 2' interconnect module.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVInterconnect "Encl1, interconnect 2" | Get-HPOVAlert -severity Critical Get 'critical' severity alerts for 'Encl1, interconnect 2' interconnect module.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the configuration of the primary NIC of the appliance

Retrieves the configuration parameters of the primary network interface on the appliance, which can be captured into a customer object for further operation, or captured to a text file in json format.
Aliases [-x, -export] Optional. Path and file name to export the resulting command output in json format.
Aliases [-x, -export] Optional. Path and file name to export the resulting command output in json format.

maml:description.maml:para: A collection object containing the properties and values of the primary network interface of the appliance.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVApplianceNetworkConfig Outputs the configuration of the primary network interface to standard output.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $myAppNetConfig = Get-HPOVApplianceNetworkConfig Outputs the configuration of the primary network interface of the appliance to the object variable $myAppNetConfig

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVApplianceNetworkConfig -exportFile "c:\myApplianceConfig\applianceNetworkConfig.json" Outputs the configuration of the primary network interface of the appliance to the file applianceNetworkConfig.json

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve EULA status.

The hostname or IP address of the HP OneView appliance. If not specified, a connection must already be established with Connect-HPOVMgmt.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVEulaStatus -appliance "myappliance.acme.com" Get the EULA status from myappliance.acme.com

maml:description.maml:para: List Directory Group role assignment.

This cmdlet will display the configured directory groups on the appliance, and display their assigned role(s). The default display will include the URI of each configured group. Use the Report switch to display only the Directory Group Name, Login Domain and assigned role(s).
Aliases [-group, -name] Configured Directory Group Name. If omitted, all configured Directory Groups will be displayed.
Export JSON content to file
Aliases [-Report] Display only the Directory Group Name, Login Domain and assigned role(s).

command:example.dev:code:

type : Group2RolesMappingPerGroupDto roles : {Network administrator} loginDomain : domain1 egroup : My Directory Group2 uri : /rest/logindomains/grouptorolemapping/1/My$_sp_$Directory$_sp_$Group2 category : users created : 2014-01-15T00:20:18.848Z modified : 2014-01-15T00:20:18.848Z eTag : 2014-01-15T00:20:18.848Z

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the installed licenses on the appliance.
This cmdlet will retrieve licenses installed on the appliance. You can use this to get an inventory of what's installed and what licenses are consumed.
Specify the type of License to retrieve. Valid options are "HP_ONE_VIEW" or "HP_ONE_VIEW_WO_ILO".
Specify the license state to retrieve. Valid options are "Unlicensed" or "Permanent".
Generate Summary Report. If omitted, a detailed report will be generated
Specify the type of License to retrieve. Valid options are "HP_ONE_VIEW" or "HP_ONE_VIEW_WO_ILO".
Specify the license state to retrieve. Valid options are "Unlicensed" or "Permanent".
Generate Summary Report. If omitted, a detailed report will be generated

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: HP OneView License report or summary.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVLicense Get installed licenses.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-HPOVLicense -summary License Name Available Consumed Total Unlicensed ------------ --------- -------- ----- ---------- HP OneView Advanced 16 16 32 0
Get a summary report of licenses

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Logical Interconnect Group resource(s).
Retrieves a list of all Logical Interconnect Groups or just specific ones via a query if the name parameter is provided. The output can be sent to a file using the exportFile parameter.
The name of the Logical Interconnect Group to retrieve.
Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the contents retrieved from the call to Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup.
The name of the Logical Interconnect Group to retrieve.
Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the contents retrieved from the call to Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: A Logical Interconnect Group or collection of Logical Interconnect Groups.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup Returns all Logical Interconnect Groups defined on the appliance to standard output.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup "Production" Returns just the Production Logical Interconnect Group object to standard output.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $myLigs = Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup Returns the Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup query and stores it in the object $myLigs

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup -exportFile "c:\myApplianceConfig\LogicaICGs.json" Returns the Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup query results to the file c:\myApplianceConfig\LogicaICGs.json

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Logical Interconnect resource(s).
Retrieves a list of all Logical Interconnect or just specific ones via a query if the name parameter is provided. The output can be sent to a file using the exportFile parameter.
The name of the Logical Interconnect to retrieve.
Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the contents retrieved from the call to Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect.
The name of the Logical Interconnect to retrieve.
Aliases [-list] Generate a report of all or a specific Logical Interconnect.
The name of the Logical Interconnect to retrieve.
Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the contents retrieved from the call to Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect.
Aliases [-list] Generate a report of all or a specific Logical Interconnect.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single Logical Interconnect
Multiple Logical Interconnects

dev:type.maml:name: A Logical Interconnect or collection of Logical Interconnects

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect Returns all Logical Interconnect defined on the appliance to standard output.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect "Production" Returns just the Production Logical Interconnect object to standard output.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $myLogicalICs = Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect Returns the Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect query and stores it in the object $myLogicalICs

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect -exportFile "c:\myApplianceConfig\LogicaICs.json" Returns the Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect query results to the file c:\myApplianceConfig\LogicaICs.json

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect -report Name Status Stacking health LIG Consistency state ---- ------ --------------- --- ----------------- Encl1-LI OK Redundantly Connected MyLIG Consistent
Interconnect Name Module Serial Number Firmware Version ----- ----------------- ------ ------------- ---------------- Encl1, interconnect 1 HP VC FlexFabric 10Gb/24-Port Module WECFSED100 4.10 Encl1, interconnect 2 HP VC FlexFabric 10Gb/24-Port Module WECFSED101 4.10
==================================================================================================================
Name Status Stacking health LIG Consistency state ---- ------ --------------- --- ----------------- Encl2-LI OK Redundantly Connected MyLIG Consistent
Interconnect Name Module Serial Number Firmware Version ----- ----------------- ------ ------------- ---------------- Encl2, interconnect 1 HP VC FlexFabric 10Gb/24-Port Module WECFSED100 4.10 Encl2, interconnect 2 HP VC FlexFabric 10Gb/24-Port Module WECFSED101 4.10
Generate a report of all Logical Interconnects

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Managed SAN resource(s).
This cmdlet is used to display or list the available Managed SAN resources in the appliance.
OPTIONAL. Managed SAN Name to retrieve.
Display the Managed SAN resources in list format for easier reading. Default will be resource object.
OPTIONAL. Managed SAN Name to retrieve.
Display the Managed SAN resources in list format for easier reading. Default will be resource object.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single Resource
Multiple Resources

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVManagedSan -list Name State Status Network Zoned Automated Zoning ---- ----- ------ ------- ----- ---------------- Fabric A Ready OK BNA Managed Fabric A Zoned True Fabric B Ready OK BNA Managed Fabric B Zoned True

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVManagedSan "Fabric A" Show the 'Fabric A' Managed SAN resource object.

maml:description.maml:para: Helper function to retrieve the Connection Template for a specific Network Set or collection of Network Sets.

Add the default connection information to the network set resource. Note that the connection information is already included in objects returned from New-HPOVNetworkSet or Get-HPOVNetworkSet; this call is normally only needed when the network resource has been returned from a call to Send-HPOVRequest.
A collection of network set resources.
A collection of network set resources.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single Network Set
Multiple Network Sets

dev:type.maml:name: The network set resources with included default connection information.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $netset = Send-HPOVRequest /rest/network-sets/fbfd5640-552e-4f2c-818d-7c7c60837665 PS C:\> Get-HPOVNetworkSetCTInfo $netset Get the network set resource & connection information for /rest/network-sets/fbfd5640-552e-4f2c-818d-7c7c60837665

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Network Set resource(s).
Retrieves a list of all Network Sets or just specific Networks Sets via a query if the name parameter is provided. The Network Set output can be sent to a file using the exportFile parameter.
The name of the Network Set to retrieve.
Display Network Set information in a formatted table.
The name of the Network Set to retrieve.
Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the contents retrieved from the call to Get-HPOVNetworkSet.
The name of the Network Set to retrieve.
Display Network Set information in a formatted table.
Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the contents retrieved from the call to Get-HPOVNetworkSet.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single Network Set
Multiple Network Sets

dev:type.maml:name: A Network Set or Network Sets collection object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVNetworkSet Returns all Network Sets defined on the appliance to standard output.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVNetworkSet "Production" Returns just the Production Network Set object to standard output.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $myNetSets = Get-HPOVNetworkSet Returns the Get-HPOVNetworkSet query and stores it in the object $myNetSets

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVNetworkSet -exportFile "c:\myApplianceConfig\Network-Sets.json" Returns the Get-HPOVNetworkSet query results to the file c:\myApplianceConfig\Network-Sets.json

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Network resource(s).
Obtain a collection of network resources which have the specified type and/or name. The default connection information is included in the returned network resources.
The name of the network resource to be returned. All network resources will be returned if omitted. Supports '*' wildcard character.

The type of the network resource to be returned. Valid types are "Ethernet" for Ethernet networks, "FC" or "FibreChannel" for Fibre Channel networks. All network resources will be returned if omitted.

Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the JSON formatted definition of the networks to a file. The directory for the file is validated prior to execution and the function returns an error is the directory does not exist.
Generate a report of the specific or all networks.
The name of the network resource to be returned. All network resources will be returned if omitted. Supports '*' wildcard character.

The type of the network resource to be returned. Valid types are "Ethernet" for Ethernet networks, "FC" or "FibreChannel" for Fibre Channel networks. All network resources will be returned if omitted.

Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the JSON formatted definition of the networks to a file. The directory for the file is validated prior to execution and the function returns an error is the directory does not exist.
Generate a report of the specific or all networks.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single Network
Multiple Networks

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $net41 = Get-HPOVNetwork -name "Net-41" Return the network resource with the name "Net-41"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ethNets = Get-HPOVNetwork -type Ethernet Return all the Ethernet network resources

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ethNets = Get-HPOVNetwork VLAN_19* Return all Ethernet Networks that match 'VLAN_19*'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVNetwork -exportFile "c:\myApplianceConfig\myNets.json" Exports all networks to the file myNets.json in JSON format.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVNetwork -x "c:\myApplianceConfig\myNets.json" -type Ethernet Exports only the ethernet networks to the file myNets.json.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-HPOVNetwork -Report Ethernet Networks -----------------
Name VLAN ID Purpose Typical Bandwidth Max Bandwidth Smartlink Private Network Status ---- ------- ------- ----------------- ------------- --------- --------------- ------ VLAN 10-A 10 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 10-B 10 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 20-A 20 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 20-B 20 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 30-A 30 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 30-B 30 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 40-A 40 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 40-B 40 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 50-A 50 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 50-B 50 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 60-A 60 General 2500 10000 True False OK VLAN 60-B 60 General 2500 10000 True False OK
FC Networks -----------
Name Fabric Type Uplink Bandwidth Link Stability Time (sec) Auto Login Redistribution Status ---- ----------- ---------------- ------------------------- ------------------------- ------ DirectAttach Fabric A DirectAttach Auto 0 False OK DirectAttach Fabric B DirectAttach Auto 0 False OK Production Fabric A FabricAttach Auto 30 True OK Production Fabric B FabricAttach Auto 30 True OK
Get all available networks, and display a report.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Power Device (iPDU) resource(s).
Obtain a collection of power device resources which have the specified name, and display the information about the power device.
The name of the power device resource to be returned. All power device resources will be returned if omitted.
The name of the power device resource to be returned. All power device resources will be returned if omitted.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $powerDevices = Get-HPOVPowerDevice Return all the power devices managed by this appliance.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Server Profile Connections
Obtain a formatted list of server profile connection IDs, include hardware address, device mapping, and boot settings.
The name of the server profile resource to be returned. All server profile resources will be returned if name is omitted.
The name of the server profile resource to be returned. All server profile resources will be returned if name is omitted.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Formatted table of Server Profile Connections.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-HPOVProfileConnectionList "test" serverProfile portId cid networkType macAddress wwpn boot arrayTarget lun ------------- -------- --- ----------- ---------- ---- ---- ----------- --- test Flb 1:1-a 1 Ethernet 36:37:6B:90:00:08 1000378079e00011 Primary test Flb 1:1-b 2 Ethernet 36:37:6B:90:00:06 1000378079e0000d Secondary
List Server Profile connections for Test.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Server Profile resource(s).

This cmdlet will obtain a collection of Server Profile resources, or a specific Server Profile the specified name. It returns all aspects of the Server Profile.
This will also provide the ability to export Server Profile objects to their own JSON encoded file. All appliance unique properties (minus the Server Hardware Type, Enclosure Group, and Connection Network assignment) are removed. Connection layout, assigned addresses, networks, bandwidth, BIOS, Boot Order, Firmware settings will all be retained. Assigned Address types will change from Virtual to UserDefined in order to retain their assignment.
The name of the server profile resource to be returned. All server profile resources will be returned if omitted. Supports * wildcard character.

Optional parameter that can be included with the List switch parameter to only display unassigned Server Profiles. Can also be combined with the name parameter for Server Profile wildcard name search.
The name of the server profile resource to be returned. All server profile resources will be returned if omitted. Supports * wildcard character.

Optional parameter that can be included with the List switch parameter to only display unassigned Server Profiles. Can also be combined with the name parameter for Server Profile wildcard name search.
Aliases [-x] Switch used to export Server Profile object to JSON encoded file.
Aliases [-save] Location where to save the Server Profile
The name of the server profile resource to be returned. All server profile resources will be returned if omitted. Supports * wildcard character.
Aliases [-report] Display report list of Server Profiles

Optional parameter that can be included with the List switch parameter to only display unassigned Server Profiles. Can also be combined with the name parameter for Server Profile wildcard name search.
The name of the server profile resource to be returned. All server profile resources will be returned if omitted. Supports * wildcard character.
Aliases [-report] Display report list of Server Profiles

Optional parameter that can be included with the List switch parameter to only display unassigned Server Profiles. Can also be combined with the name parameter for Server Profile wildcard name search.
Aliases [-x] Switch used to export Server Profile object to JSON encoded file.
Aliases [-save] Location where to save the Server Profile

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single Server Profile
Multiple Server Profiles

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $profiles = Get-HPOVProfile Return all the server profiles managed by the appliance.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $profile = Get-HPOVProfile "SA" Return the server profile resource with name "SA".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $profiles = Get-HPOVProfile profile* Return server profile resources that match 'profile*'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-HPOVProfile -list Profile Name Managing BIOS Managing Firmware Assigned State ------------ ------------- ----------------- -------- ----- Copy of test 2 False False Unassigned Normal Profile 11 True True Encl1, bay 11 Normal Profile 12 False False Encl1, bay 12 Normal Profile 13 False False Encl1, bay 13 Normal Profile 14 False False Encl1, bay 14 Normal Profile 15 False False Encl1, bay 15 Normal Profile 16 False False Encl1, bay 16 Normal Test 1 False False Unassigned Normal test 2 False False Encl1, bay 3 Normal test 3 False False Unassigned Normal
Generate a list of all server profiles.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> get-hpovprofile -name 'test 1' -list Profile Name Managing BIOS Managing Firmware Assigned State ------------ ------------- ----------------- -------- ----- Test 1 False False Unassigned Normal
Generate a report of a specific server profile.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-HPOVProfile -list -unassigned Profile Name Managing BIOS Managing Firmware Assigned State ------------ ------------- ----------------- -------- ----- Copy of test 2 False False Unassigned Normal Test 1 False False Unassigned Normal test 3 False False Unassigned Normal
Generate a list of all Unassigned server profiles.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 7 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVProfile -export -location c:\profiles Save all Server Profile objects to their own backup file to C:\profiles.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 8 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVProfile -name Profile1 -export -location c:\profiles Save Profile1 Server Profile object to its own backup file in C:\profiles.

maml:description.maml:para: Get role of user.

maml:description.maml:para: Get State Change Message Bus certificates.
Retrieve and store the certificates necessary to register with the State Change Message Bus. The SCMB only supports a single read-only "account".
Aliases [-Save] Directory to store the SSL certificates. If the directory doesn't exist, it will be created.
Aliases [-pfx] Convert rabbitmq_readonly client certificate to PFX format for .Net consumption.
Password that will be used to encrypt the PFX client certificate.
Aliases [-Save] Directory to store the SSL certificates. If the directory doesn't exist, it will be created.
Aliases [-Save] Directory to store the SSL certificates. If the directory doesn't exist, it will be created.
Aliases [-pfx] Convert rabbitmq_readonly client certificate to PFX format for .Net consumption.
Password that will be used to encrypt the PFX client certificate.
Password for PFX file

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $directory = 'C:\scmbcerts' PS C:\> Get-HPOVScmbCertificates $directory
Get the HP OneView appliance SCMB SSL certificates, and save them in C:\scmbcerts.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> read-host -AsSecureString | Get-HPOVScmbCertificates C:\scmbcerts -pfx Prompt for secure password input and pipe the value to Get-HPOVScmbCertificates to convert the cert.pem to PFX format with the pipeline secure password.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Server Hardware Type resource(s).

Obtain a collection of server hardware types. This includes information about the type of server, adapter layout and features, and possible server BIOS settings. This cmdlet is also used with the New-HPOVProfile cmdlet to retrieve the list of BIOS settings and adapters to configure.
The name or URI of the server hardware type resource to be returned. All server hardware type resources will be returned if omitted.
The name or URI of the server hardware type resource to be returned. All server hardware type resources will be returned if omitted.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single Server Hardware type
Multiple Server Hardware types.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $sht = Get-HPOVServerHardwareType Return all the server hardware types on the appliance.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $shtBL460Gen81 = Get-HPOVServerHardwareType -name "BL460 Gen8 1" Return the "BL460 Gen8 1" server hardware type on the appliance.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve available SPP Baseline information.
Retrieves the list of SPPs that have been uploaded to the appliance, and their detail. You can examine the included components and their versions reported by the baseline.
Optional. The ISO file name of an SPP.
Optional. The SPP/Baseline Name.
Optional. If multiple SPP/Baselines with the same name exist, use the Version parameter to filter to the specific SPP/Baseline version.
Optional. The ISO file name of an SPP.
Optional. The SPP/Baseline Name.
Optional. If multiple SPP/Baselines with the same name exist, use the Version parameter to filter to the specific SPP/Baseline version.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single SPP resource object
Multiple SPP resource objects

dev:type.maml:name: The firmware-baseline object or collection of firmware-baseline objects if no sppFile is provided in the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $sppCollection = Get-HPOVSppFile Retrieves all SPP objects from the appliance and stores them in the sppCollection object

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $sppObject = Get-HPOVSppFIle SPP2012060B.2012_0525.1.iso Retrieves an SPP object with the filename SPP2012060B.2012_0525.1.iso

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $sppObject = Get-HPOVSppFIle -SppName "HP Service Pack for ProLiant" Retrieves an SPP object with the SPP Name 'HP Service Pack for ProLiant'

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Storage Pool resource(s).
Obtain a collection of storage pools (i.e. CPG's) from discovered and managed storage systems.
The name of the specific storage pool resource to be returned. All storage pool resources will be returned if omitted.

The name or Storage System object of the specific storage system to return storage pool resource from. Can be combined with the PoolName parameter to single out a specific storage pool in a specific storage system.
The name of the specific storage pool resource to be returned. All storage pool resources will be returned if omitted.

The name or Storage System object of the specific storage system to return storage pool resource from. Can be combined with the PoolName parameter to single out a specific storage pool in a specific storage system.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single Storage Pool resource
Multiple Storage Pool resources

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $myPool = Get-HPOVStoragePool -name "HP_CPG1" Return the storage pool resource(s) with the name "HP_CPG1"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $myPools = Get-HPOVStoragePool Return all the storage pool resources

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVStoragePool -StorageSystem "HP_3PAR_1" Returns all managed storage pool resources on the storage system "HP_3PAR_1"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVStoragePool -poolName "HP_CPG1" -systemName "HP_3PAR_1" Returns the storage pool resource "HP_CPG1" on the storage system "HP_3PAR_1"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-HPOVStoragePool -List Status Name Storage System Storage Domain Drive Type RAID Total Allocated Free Volumes Volume Templates ------ ---- -------------- -------------- ---------- ---- -------- ----------- ------- ------- ---------------- OK FC_NO_DN ThreePAR7200-5706 NoDomain FC RAID5 1,048,576.00GB 22.13GB 1,048,553.88GB 0 2 OK FC_NO_DN ThreePAR7200-2870 NoDomain FC RAID5 1,048,576.00GB 22.13GB 1,048,553.88GB 8 1
Get all available storage pools, and display a report.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Storage System resource(s).

Aliases [-Report] Optional. Generate a report of the specific or all storage systems.

maml:description.maml:para: Retreive Storage Volume Template Global Policy.

By default, Storage Volumes can be created without reference to a Storage Volume Template. This cmdlet will display the global policy setting. Use Set-HPOVStorageVolumeTemplatePolicy to modify the global policy setting.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Task resource(s).
Obtain a collection of task resources which have the specified name and/or state. The returned data will include the task name, owner, state and status.
Aliases [-Name] The name of the task resource to be returned. All names will match if omitted.
Related resource Name, URI or Object to the task. To be used for filtering tasks specific to a resource object (i.e. Server Profile).

The state of the task resource a to be returned. May be one of the following strings:
• Unknown • New • Running • Suspended • Terminated • Killed • Completed • Error • Warning
All states will match if omitted. All tasks will be returned if both names and state are omitted.
Specify the maximum amount of task objects to return. 0 will return all found task objects.
Display task resources in a formatted table.
Aliases [-Name] The name of the task resource to be returned. All names will match if omitted.

Aliases [-Category] Specify the Resource Category to filter task results to. Cannot be combined with Resource parameter.

• ethernet-networks • fc-networks • power-devices • unmanaged-devices • server-profiles • server-hardware • enclosures • enclosure-groups • interconnects • logical-interconnects • logical-interconnect-groups • appliance • firmware-drivers

The state of the task resource a to be returned. May be one of the following strings:
• Unknown • New • Running • Suspended • Terminated • Killed • Completed • Error • Warning

maml:description.maml:para: Get Unmanaged Devices.

HP OneView provides administrators with the capability to define unmanaged devices to them place within Racks, in order to provide a more realistic and complete data center layout. This cmdlet will retrieve all or a specified Unmanaged Device. A report switch is provided to display the output in an easier to read format.
The name of the Unmanaged Device.
Aliases [-report] Display the Unmanaged Device(s) in a table format.
The name of the Unmanaged Device.
Aliases [-report] Display the Unmanaged Device(s) in a table format.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single Unmanaged Device resource object.
Multiple Unmanaged Device resource objects.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVUnmanagedDevice Get all unmanaged devices.

maml:description.maml:para: Retreive Uplink Set resource(s).

This cmdlet will retrieve the list of all Uplink Sets or specific by the name. The cmdlet will only display provisioned Uplink Sets that are members of a Logical Interconnect resource. To view Uplink Sets of a Logical Interconnect Group, use the Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup CMDLET.
Name of Uplink Set
Name of the Logical Interconnect to show associated Uplink Set.
Generate a report of the defined Uplink Sets. Includes Uplink Set type, networks, redundancy report, and assigned uplink ports.
Name of the Logical Interconnect to show associated Uplink Set.

Specify the Uplink Set Type to display. Will display all Uplink Sets of the type provided. Allowed values:
• Ethernet • FibreChannel
Generate a report of the defined Uplink Sets. Includes Uplink Set type, networks, redundancy report, and assigned uplink ports.

• Ethernet • FibreChannel
Generate a report of the defined Uplink Sets. Includes Uplink Set type, networks, redundancy report, and assigned uplink ports.

maml:description.maml:para: Display library component versions.
Display either the HP OneView PowerShell library or appliance version. Displaying the Appliance version will provide the Major, Minor, full version, and X-API Version information.
Aliases [-appliance] Include the appliance version.
Aliases [-appliance] Include the appliance version.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-HPOVVersion -appliance Name Value ---- ----- applMajorVersion 1 applMinorVersion 10 applVersionInfo 1.10.03-103740 applXApiVersion 101 OneViewPowerShellLibrary 1.10.1314
Get the HP OneView PowerShell library, Appliance and X-API version information

maml:description.maml:para: Get appliance API version
Returns the API versions supported by the appliance. You do not need to authenticate, or call Connect-HPOVMgmt, to an appliance in order to retrieve the supported REST API Versions by the appliance.
Optional: The hostname or IP Address of the appliance. If you do not authenticate to the appliance with Connect-HPOVMgmt, this parameter is required.
Optional: The hostname or IP Address of the appliance. If you do not authenticate to the appliance with Connect-HPOVMgmt, this parameter is required.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: The current and minimum supported API versions on the appliance.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> (Get-HPOVXApiVersion myAppliance.acme.com).minimumversion This example retrieves the minimum XApi version supported by the appliance. An existing connection is not needed since the appliance name is provided.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> (Get-HPOVXApiVersion).minimumversion This example retrieves the minimum XApi version supported by the appliance and requires that a connection has been established by using Connect-HPOVMgmt.

maml:description.maml:para: Import an appliance SSL Certificate.

By default, the HP OneView appliance creates a self-signed SSL Certificate for its WebUI. There might be a desire to trust the certificate, in case the SHA-1 hash becomes invalid (either due to a certificate change or man-in-the-middle attack) and the caller would like to be notified. This cmdlet will assist in retrieving and storing the appliance self-generated SSL Certificate into the current users Trusted Root Certification Authorities store.
Please note that the Subject Alternate Name (SAN) must match that of the Appliance hostname you use to connect to your appliance. If it does not, an SSL conenction failure will ocurr. When creating a CSR on the appliance, make sure to include the additional FQDN and IP address(es) in the Alternative Name field.
Used to specify the applinace to connect to, if an existing connection isn't established from the Connect-HPOVMgmt cmdlet.
Used to specify the applinace to connect to, if an existing connection isn't established from the Connect-HPOVMgmt cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Import-HPOVSslCertificate -appliance hpov.contoso.com Import the SSL certificate from the specific appliance.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Connect-HPOVMgmt hpov.contoso.com Administrator MyP@ssword PS C:\> Import-HPOVSslCertificate Import the SSL Certificate from the existing connection provided by the Connect-HPOVMgmt cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Install Logical Interconnect Firmware.

Use this cmdlet to install/update the Logical Interconnect (i.e. Virtual Connect) firmware. You can provide the Logical Interconnect Name, URI or Object and must specify a valid SPP Baseline present on the appliance.
This cmdlet will default to performing an Update (Stage + Activate), which will cause an outage. If you wish to avoid an outage, first stage the update usind -method stage, then -method activate. Interconnect activation can be controlled with the -ActivateOrder parameter, which defaults to Odd interconnects. Once the specified interconnect activation is complete, you must then call the cmdlet again with the alternate ActivateOrder value (i.e. even.)
Aliases [-li, -uri, -name] The Logical Interconnect object(s), name(s) or uris(s) to be updated.

Upgrade method to perform. Accepted values are:
• UPDATE (Default) • STAGE • ACTIVATE

Aliases [-order] Specify the Firmware activation order. Accepted values are:
• Odd (Default) • Even • All
Firmware Baseline Name, URI or Object
Force the firmware update if the update version matches what is already installed.
Aliases [-li, -uri, -name] The Logical Interconnect object(s), name(s) or uris(s) to be updated.

Upgrade method to perform. Accepted values are:
• UPDATE (Default) • STAGE • ACTIVATE

Aliases [-order] Specify the Firmware activation order. Accepted values are:
• Odd (Default) • Even • All
Firmware Baseline Name, URI or Object
Force the firmware update if the update version matches what is already installed.
Logical Inteconnect URI or Name
An Array of Logical Interconnect resource URI's, Names or Objects.
Logical Interconnect Resource Object
A single or collection of update Task(s).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $li = Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect Encl1-LI PS C:\> $spp = Get-HPOVSppFile "HP Service Pack for ProLiant" PS C:\> $task = Install-HPOVLogicalInterconnectFirmware Stage $li $spp PS C:\> Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task PS C:\> $task = Install-HPOVLogicalInterconnectFirmware Activate $li PS C:\> Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task PS C:\> $task = Install-HPOVLogicalInterconnectFirmware Activate $li -Order Even PS C:\> Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task Perform a firmware update of the Encl1-LI Logical Interconnect by first staging the firmware. Then Acitate the firmware using the default Odd Interconnect Bay order, and then Activate the Even bays.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect Encl1-LI | Install-HPOVLogicalInterconnectFirmware -method Update -baseline "HP Service Pack for ProLiant" -confirm:$false | Wait-HPOVTaskComplete Perform a firmware update of the Encl1-LI Logical Interconnect, do not prompt for confirmation, then wait for the task to complete.

maml:description.maml:para: Migrate Virtual Connect Manager to HP OneView.

This function is used to migrate an existing Virtual Connect Manager configuration to HP OneView. If an enclosure was added to an HP OneView appliance as Monitor-Only, then you must first remove the enclosure from the appliance, and then use this cmdlet to migrate the enclosure.
Using the -VCEMCMS, -VCEMUser and -VCEMPassword parameters, the targeted Virtual Connect Domain can be removed from a Virual Connect Enterprise Manager Domain Group first before initiating the VC Migration tool within the HP OneView appliance.
{ADD NOTE ABOUT WHERE TO OBTAIN THE VCEM 7.4 Update Patch for API}
It is important to also have a Virtual Connect Domain Backup prior to migration. You may also want to gather the output from the 'show config -includepoolinfo' VCM CLI command to review or verify resources were migrated successfully.
Please read 'Chapter 9 Planning for enclosure migration from VCM into HP OneView' in the HP OneView 1.20 User Guide for more information about migration and other planning resources.
Aliases [-oaip] REQUIRED. IP address or FQDN of the Primary Onboard Administrator in the target enclosure.
Aliases[-ou] REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target OA.
Aliases[-op] REQUIRED. Password for the Administrator account of the target OA.
Aliases[-vu] REQUIRED. Administrator account for Virtual Connect Manager.
Aliases[-vp] REQUIRED. Password for the Administrator account of Virtual Connect Manager.

Aliases[-eg] OPTIONAL. The Name, URI or Object of an existing enclosure group. If omitted, a new Enclosure Group and Logical Interconnect Group will be created based on the Serial Number of the Enclosure (Example: 'EG_USE1234567A' or 'LIG_USE1234567A').

Aliases[-license, -l] REQUIRED. Specifies whether the intent is to apply either OneView or OneView w/o iLO licenses to the servers in the enclosure being imported.
Accepted values are
• OneView • OneViewNoiLO
OPTIONAL. Do not wait on the migration task to complete. If omitted, the cmdlet will monitor the task to completion before returning control to the caller.
When attempting to migrate an existing Virtual Connect configuration to the appliance and there are no errors, confirmation is needed. Use -Confirm:$false to bypass the confirmation.

Aliases[-license, -l] REQUIRED. Specifies whether the intent is to apply either OneView or OneView w/o iLO licenses to the servers in the enclosure being imported.
Accepted values are
